snippet: In South Africa, nothing, not even a singing competition, escapes examination under a powerful racial lens.
abstract: Khaya Mthethwa is the first black contestant to win Idols SA, the South African version of American Idol; the country's deep imbalances in wealth has blocked black contestants from the top spot for seven years.
lead_paragraph: In South Africa, nothing, not even a singing competition, escapes examination under a powerful racial lens.

headline.seo: South Africa Reflects on Black Singer’s ‘Idols’ Victory
headline.main: South Africa Has a Black ‘Idol.’ The Surprise Is That It’s a First.
headline.print_headline: South Africa Has a Black ‘Idol.’ The Surprise Is That It’s a First.
